title: first-website
text:
mtcars |>
  select(mpg, wt) |>
  ggplot(aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = 'lm', formula = 'y ~ x', se = FALSE) +
  theme_clean() +
  labs(x = "Weight (1000s of lbs)", y = "MPG",
       title = "Fuel Efficiency and Weight",
       subtitle = "Heavier cars are less fuel efficient",
       caption = "Henderson and Vellerman (1981)")

title: About
text: My name is Avery Zheng, and I’m currently a junior (11th grade) at Phillips Academy Andover.

title: About
text: My name is Avery Zheng, and I’m currently a junior (11th grade) at Phillips Academy Andover.

title: About
text:
About the Project
Fuel Efficiency and Weight is a project that graphically explores the relationship between a car’s weight and its efficiency, measured in thousands of pounds and mpg, respectively.

Goals

Explore the relationship between weight and fuel efficiency

Data may be hard to find

Practice graphing in R

“This is data science”
~Preceptor
“Kane’s Free Data Science Bootcamp”
